One UN national staff member was stabbed during a robbery while exiting a taxi.
One UN staff member sustained injuries to his head after being assaulted by police officers affecting an arrest in the UN compound.
One LNGO staff member was attacked and killed by unknown gunmen in Shahjoy Bazaar area of Qalat Province.
One contracted employee who was transporting an IO food commodities in a contracted truck was shot and killed in a robbery incident.

Four drivers of commercial trucks carrying INGO food items were abducted by AOG while on the road; two managed to get free a few hours later, and the remaining two were released the following evening.
One INGO incentive worker guard was injured when a Police vehicle escorting the INGO team was targeted by an IED.
Two IO contracted drivers were injured during an explosion nearby a SARC (IO Partner) warehouse.

One female INGO staff member was sexually assaulted and subsequently hospitalized after five masked men broke into the NGO guesthoust and robbed the residents.  Three other staff members were present, but seem to have been unhurt.
An NGO staff member was stabbed to death by his neighbour when an argument between the two turned violent.
Nine volunteers and two staff with the Syrian Arab Red Crescent were injured when a distribution point in al-Qusur was hit with a mortar shell.

One INGO staff member was killed when the car he was traveling in was stopped by AOG at an illegal checkpoint.  Four others were in the car (not staff members); three of them were also killed but one was released to report the incident.  There is no indication that the incident was related to his work.
One NGO staff member was assaulted and robbed by four young men.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed when unknown attackers shot at a marked NGO vehicle travelling on the Bor to Juba road.
One staff member was killed and one wounded when their vehicle was attacked.
One INGO female staff member was shot and killed.
One refugee male day worker was severely assaulted during a riot at the INGO's compound.
One INGO staffer was beaten with an iron bar and received treatment from MSF Holland at their medical facility.
Two national staff were injured in an assault during distribution at the refugee camp.
column: Bin Qirdān, Gouvernorat de Médenine, Tunisia

details_(public): One national male doctor was beaten by unknown armed insurgents over a personal matter.
One male international staffer injured when 50 to 60 Chadians raided the INGO compound.
National female hit by shrapnel of an IED while standing on road waiting for taxi to travel between two work sites.
Male national staffer was severely beaten with metal pipe while at work premises.
Female national staff was attacked during robbery on the road and received 2 stab wounds.
Male national staff was kidnapped while traveling on road during vaccination campaign. He had previously been warned to stop working. He was held for a few days and released unharmed.

One female UN staff member was physically and sexually assaulted while on R&R in country. The motive appears to be political for a number of reasons, including because her belongings were searched during the assault as well as the location where she was treated.
One driver of an INGO ambulance was seriously injured when struck with small arms fire while in the crossfire between ANSF and AOG fighters.
One NGO staff member was injured when an ANA fired mortar shell landed in a residential area.
One UN staff member was killed.

One off-duty NGO national staff member was killed while acting as a bodyguard to a local powerbroker when they were ambushed while in transit.  This is likely related to a family and/or tribal dispute.
One INGO staff member was killed by a staff member of another INGO allegedly over domestic dispute.
One American working for an NGO was slashed by an assailant on her face and neck and robbed while on a commuter train.
A guard of an NGO-run clinic was shot and wounded when three armed men tried to gain access to the clinic and were refused.
One driver was shot when gunmen opened fire on four UN-contracted trucks.
One INGO ambulance driver was wounded with small arms fire when passing through an clash between AOG and ANSF.
One assistant driver of an IO-contracted food delivery truck was killed when a roadside IED exploded against his truck.

Two international aid workers were kidnapped and safely released three days later. Security officials said it was probably the work of hostage takers since the area is not a stronghold of the insurgency.
Five national staff members of an INGO were kidnapped while traveling in a taxi returning to their field office. All five were later killed.  This was not a targeted incident.
One NGO staff member was injured when a stray mortar struck a school where s/he was delivering a training.
One UN staff member was shot and killed by IDF soldiers during clashes on an overnight arrest raid at the Qalandia refugee camp.
One UN staff member was assaulted by a person suspected to be an SPLA soldier while walking from the Olympic hotel in Juba.

One UN staff member was robbed and assaulted by two unknown masked men who entered and robbed his home, then removed him by force from his home and brought him to the forest where they continued to assault him and ask for money.
A national staff driver was wounded when a body-borne IED was detonated. The attack was aimed at Afghanistan National Police.
A Syrian doctor was kidnapped from Sejou village where he was working and found killed one day later in Aleppo province.

Three male NGO national staff members and two drivers - affiliated with an NSP project - were kidnapped and released three days later on September 8th following negotiations by the local community, elders and community representatives to help secure their release.
One UN staff member was assaulted by three persons who allegedly disguised themselves as visitors at his residence in Kalibalak, Bentiu. He was evacuated to the hospital.
Robbers at a UN compound assaulted the UN-contracted guard, who was taken to the hospital for treatment.
During an evacuation, two national staffers of an INGO were killed in transit while returning to base from a construction site in the area of Bossangoa.
Two NGO staff members were hospitalized as a result of an AOG-initiated bomb blast accompanying a complex attack close to the NGO office. The NGO office was not the target of the attack.
Two national staff members of a demining INGO were kidnapped by AOG while traveling from Islam Qala toward Herat. They were released the following day.
Five local Red Cross volunteers were injured when Nur Misuari-led faction of the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) fired a rifle grenade in Barangay Sta. Catalina, Zamboanga City.
One female social worker employed by a local NGO was kidnapped by unidentified armed men and killed.

One UN staff member was assaulted after group of people at the scene of road traffic accident forcibly asked the staff member to transport a non-UN casualty to a hospital - while the injured was being received at the hospital, an unknown person assaulted the staff member.
Two UN personnel and a UN contractor were reported injured during a complex attack by al-Shabaab at the Westgate Shopping Mall in Nairobi.

city: Dashte Baboos  (Anar Dara-Farah City Main Road)
details_(public): One NGO ambulance driver was kidnapped by AOG at an illegal checkpoint. The driver was released unharmed in the Islam Abad area of Khaki Safed District unharmed, following the intervention of local elders.
One female NGO worker was shot and killed by her husband in an honor killing.

Four locally-employed workers (three labourers and a driver) who were subcontracted by a Community Development Council for an NGO-implemented NSP programme were killed after being intercepted by AOG while en route to a stone quarry.
One UN staff member sustained injuries during a fight with three robbers at his home.

A local NGO director was reportedly kidnapped for ransom by armed men while heading to his office.  The rescue attempt failed to recover the victim.  UPDATE: the director was freed on 7 December 2013 by his abductors in Mastung district.
A national staffer of an INGO was abducted on the road.

city: Sanaa, Haddah , in front of the Al-Jandool supermarket
details_(public): A UN international staff member was ambushed and kidnapped by armed men while he was in his vehicle. UPDATE: He was released on 8 November 2014.
Three national NGO staff members (driver and two engineers) were ambushed and kidnapped. A third engineer was present but managed to escape.
Two UN staff members were severely assaulted and sustained multiple stab wounds at the vicinity of their compound in the evening. They were admitted into a hospital for treatment.
One NGO staff member was assaulted by an SPLA soldier.
An off-duty NGO staff member, along with seven other civilians, was killed when the bazaar was struck by a rocket launched by an armed opposition group.  Nine other civilians were injured.

A community health worker, who seemed to have ties to Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan (IEA) fighters, was abducted by members of the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).  He was abducted with at least three IEA fighters, who were able to escape, but the community health worker was recaptured and killed.  He was beaten to death with sticks.

city: Shahbed  (Herat-Kandahar Main Road), Adraskan district (borders of)
details_(public): Two local NGO workers were shot and wounded when the bus they were traveling on was fired at by armed men attempting an ambush at an illegal checkpoint. The bus kept driving and victims received medical treatment.

The head of a Sudanese NGO was killed when armed carjackers ambushed and hijacked the NGO vehicle.  Another NGO staff member and a police officer were also injured. The attack happened about 15 kilometers southwest of Nyala.

city: Abu Hamra, along Nyala-El Fasher Road
details_(public): A UN contractor was carjacked and abducted by unknown criminals while driving along the Nyala-El Fasher road.
One Syrian Arab Red Crescent volunteer of the Ein Al Arab sub-branch in Aleppo was killed.

One international worker was injured and one national worker killed during an armed break-in at an orphanage. Three burglars assaulted them with a hammer and demanded money.  The national worker was an unarmed security guard who died protecting the international staff member.
One national staff member working for an INGO implementing partner was abducted by five unknown armed men.  The individual was released two days later on November 13 after a local elder mediated.
Three national staff members of a UN implementing partner were abducted by an unknown armed group.  They were released the next day with the help of tribal elders.
An off-duty NGO staff member was shot and killed by two unknown gunmen.

Six ICRC staff and one Syrian Arab Red Crescent volunteer were abducted by gunmen who had opened fire on the Red Cross convoy as they were traveling to Damascus.  Three ICRC staff and the one Red Crescent volunteer were released the next day.  The ICRC is awaiting information on the remaining three.
Two local NGO staff members were abducted by unknown individuals.

One female and one male NGO staff member were injured when their NGO vehicle was attacked by anti-government forces. Three other NGO staff were on board, and they were rescued by Afghan Local Police after an attempted kidnapping.
A security guard was injured when unknown individuals hurled a hand grenade inside an INGO guest house. Staff was relocated to Islamabad.

city: Ghouta, a suburb southeast of Damascus City
details_(public): A UN staff member was killed when a mortar shell struck his vehicle as he was driving near Damascus airport.  He and three other passengers in the vehicle were killed instantly.
One national UN staff member was injured when two teenagers attempted to steal his laptop bag. He received medical care at a UN hospital.
Three aid workers involved in a village-level development project were killed by a remote-controlled bomb.

Six Afghan staff of an INGO were killed and one was wounded when they were attacked by insurgents, who opened fire on them. The aid workers, who were working on different projects, may have been deliberately singled out for attack.

Two international NGO staff members, while walking on the hillside above Babur Gardens, were approached by three young men who stole their phones and wallets.  The perpetrators beat the male staff member when he tried to retrieve their phones.  He sustained injuries and received medical treatment.

Two INGO staff and their driver, while distributing food at a school, were abducted by anti-government extremists. (A third INGO staff member was present but managed to escape.)  After community elders intervened, the two INGO staff and the driver were released two days later on December 3.
A UN staff member was killed by shrapnel from a mortar round that struck her residence.
One UN staff member suffered head injuries on 9 July 2013 when a shell exploded at the southern end of Palestine Street in Yarmouk.  He subsequently died five days later on 14 July 2013.
A UN staff member suffered injuries when he was hit by shrapnel from a nearby explosion in Khan Eshieh camp on 13 March.  He died from his injuries the next day.
An UN staff member died in Yarmouk refugee camp.
A UN staff member was struck by a bullet.
A UN staff member was killed in crossfire near his home.
An INGO staff member was stabbed and killed by the son of the mayor of Faizabad.
One off-duty INGO national staff member was shot and killed by armed intruders at his home.  The attack seems to have been religiously motivated.

Two Germans and one Yemeni co-worker were killed and one Yemeni co-worker was wounded in an attack by Al Qaeda-linked militants on the Yemeni defense ministry complex (two additional staff were present but unhurt). The German staff were in the hospital due to medical treatment. The complex was targeted because it supposedly accommodated drone control rooms and American experts.  Over 50 people were killed and over 160 injured in the attack.

city: Damagun town of Fune Local Government Area
details_(public): One NGO staff member suffered gunshot wounds when the NGO was robbed by gunmen.
A security guard for an INGO compound was attacked by an armed intruder.  The guard was hospitalized and is in stable condition.
One UN contractor de-mining staff member was abducted by unknown gunmen in Musa Qala District.
An NGO humanitarian worker was killed by unknown robbers.
One nationally recruited INGO member was injured by a stray bullet when a fight involving the Sudan People's Liberation Army (SPLA) erupted.
One UN Agency Implementing Partner staff member was traveling in the organization's vehicle when stopped by an armed group and subsequently abducted.
An INGO staff member was killed by Nuer youth during an attack on a UN base in Akobo, where the staff was taking refuge.  The attack seems to have been ethnically motivated.

Five international staffers of an INGO (Belgian, Danish, Peruvian, Swedish, and Swiss) were forcibly taken from the organization's residence in Northern Syria 'for questioning,' and have been out of contact since 2 January.  As a result, the organization closed some of its medical facilities in the area.  UPDATE: Three were released on 4 April and the remaining two on 14 May 2014.

Two UN staff members were held against their will by refugees who believed the presence of the UN would prevent an attack by local villagers (the refugees feared a retaliatory attack as there was an altercation between the two parties on 1 January 2014).  One UN staff member was released on 3 January 2014, and the other on 4 January 2014.
A national polio worker contracted by the UN was abducted by suspected Al Shabaab near Buur Hakaba.  It appears that Al Shabaab believed those associated with the polio campaign to be spies.
Three local staff of an INGO were killed during a mortar attack.
Four UN-contracted polio doctors were abducted, taken to a desert area, and harshly beaten by anti-government forces.  They were released a few hours later.
One international UN staffer was robbed and attacked on the street, suffering substantial injuries and requiring hospitalization.
One Syrian Arab Red Crescent volunteer, after having disappeared for five months, died on 8 January 2014.

Two UN international staff were killed in a complex attack (one suicide bomber, two gunmen) at Taverna du Leban Restaurant in Kabul.  The Taliban confirmed responsibility for the attack.  At least 21 people (13 internationals and eight Afghans) have been reported dead.
A female aid worker was drugged and sexually assaulted by a local businessman.  She subsequently attempted suicide and was hospitalized.
A national UN staff member, while in his private residence, was stabbed in the chest by an unknown person.
Three members of a UN-contracted demining team were stopped on the road and abducted by anti-government forces. UPDATE: The deminers were released on 5 February after tribal elders intervened.
A UN-contracted volunteer vaccinator was shot and killed by Afghan Local Police.
A local ICRC staff member was assaulted by IDPs when they reportedly heard the staff member discussing politics over the phone. The staff member was hospitalized.
The director of a local NGO was shot by unknown individuals while on his way home.
One Syrian Arab Red Crescent driver was injured when an aid convoy came under attack from mortars and gunfire as it was exiting Homs.

city: Jacobabad, near Yar Mohammad Domki village
details_(public): One male staff member of a local NGO was wounded when his vehicle was shot at.  There were two other staffers aboard the vehicle, but they were unharmed.

city: on the road between the towns of Kidal and Gao
details_(public): Four ICRC staff members and a veterinarian from another aid organization were kidnapped by MUJAO, a jihadist militant group, while traveling from Kidal to Gao. UPDATE: All five were rescued on 17 April 2014 by French troops near Timbuktu; they are in good health.
One INGO security guard was abducted by armed anti-government elements, who also stole computers and documents from the INGO.
The director of a local NGO was killed in his office.  Further details are unavailable at the moment.

Two national UN staff members, part of a polio vaccination team, were abducted by armed gunmen.  Four other team members were also abducted.  An investigation is underway.  UPDATE: All six were released unharmed on 29 April 2014.

An INGO-contracted driver was shot in the arm by a man fleeing on a motorcycle; the driver was hospitalized and is in stable condition.  Two other staff members were aboard the vehicle but seem to have been unhurt.
One Ukrainian Red Cross Society volunteer was wounded while providing medical assistance during the unrest in Kiev.

city: near the landing strip of the Kidal airport
details_(public): Two local INGO staff were injured when their vehicle drove over an improvised explosive device (IED) on the road.  Both have been hospitalized but are in stable condition.
An INGO national staff sustained injuries when he was robbed and stabbed by three robbers.
A UN-contracted deminer, along with two civilians, was killed by an IED fixed to a motorcycle.
One ICRC staff member was killed during a clash between French troops and Seleka rebels.  Three other ICRC staff were present but were unhurt.
Three UN-contracted vaccinators were killed when their vehicle struck an IED.
One INGO female staff member was abducted, but was released three days later.
A Central African Red Cross volunteer was shot and killed in his parents' home.
One ICRC warehouse storekeeper was killed by a stray bullet while on his way home from work in a private car.
An NGO employee working for a health clinic was abducted by anti-government elements.
A Sudanese Red Crescent Society volunteer died in a landmine explosion, when he was on his way to respond to an emergency.
An INGO national staff member was shot and injured just as he reached his house, on his way home from work.  He was subsequently hospitalized.
Three UN-contracted deminers, while traveling in a private vehicle, were abducted at gunpoint by anti-government elements.  UPDATE: All three were freed unharmed on 31 March in Shinkay District.
Two polio workers were abducted on 21 November and found dead the following day by Afghan National Police.
One INGO driver was stabbed by armed men who seized a water pump and demanded money for its return.
Three aid workers were killed by unknown armed elements who looted several UN and NGO properties in Jonglei State.
Two local contractors of a INGO were abducted by the militia after an attack on Khor Abeche IDP camp.
A national NGO staff member was stabbed, allegedly by a group of young Muslims, and found dead.

One UN staff member was shot in the leg by five armed robbers who broke into his personal residence and stole valuables; he was hospitalized and is in stable condition.  The robbers also killed one security guard.
One INGO staff member was hit in the head and subsequently hospitalized when unknown individuals threw stones at the INGO vehicle.
During a break-in, one INGO member was stabbed in the hand.
One INGO staff member was beaten by a group of unknown men in Yerevan.  He was subsequently hospitalized and required surgery.

One INGO truck driver and his assistant began arguing for some unknown reason, and the conflict escalated to the assistant stabbing the truck driver outside of the INGO warehouse.  The driver was hospitalized.

One security guard at an INGO compound was struck by the butt of a gun when he intervened in a conflict between the assailant and another INGO staff member.  The guard sustained a deep wound and was hospitalized.
Two INGO staff members were severely beaten by six masked men attempting to rob their guest house.
One national INGO staff member was killed due to fighting between two tribal groups.
One international consultant was shot and killed as he was withdrawing money from a bank.
One UN staff member was assaulted by an SPLA officer in Wunrock. The staff sustained serious injuries and was taken to a clinic, where the perpetrator threatened the doctor not to treat the victim.
One national INGO staff member was injured when Murule tribesmen attacked an aid convoy.  The convoy was traveling with a local leader, who was the target of the attack.
An INGO staff member was walking when he was stabbed in the back by three men.
Two INGO staff members were injured (one shot and one severely beaten) when their aid convoy was attacked by seven armed men.
Three INGO staff members were tied up and beaten by drunk SPLA members for refusing to pay a bribe.
One INGO staff member was beaten by Seleka members at a checkpoint.
One INGO staff member was attacked by refugees, who were upset about the lack of food.  The staff member sufferred a broken nose.
One INGO staff member was abducted and very severely beaten by three armed militia men.  The attack may be related to tribal politics.
Three INGO staff members were injured by flying glass after an IED detonation.
One INGO staffer was shot during a carjacking.
One INGO staff member was kidnapped for a few days, beaten, and extorted of money by militiamen.
One INGO staffer was injured when a mortar landed inside the INGO project site; the staff received shrapnel to the chest.
One INGO contracted driver was killed when his vehicle hit an IED.
Two INGO staff members were killed during an attack on a UN base in Bor.

One American doctor was shot and killed by a member of the Afghan police assigned to protect the hospital.  Two other American doctors, who were guests at the hospital and not affiliated with the INGO, were also killed. A fourth American doctor (also a guest) was wounded.

Three INGO staff members were killed by armed ex-Seleka members during a meeting with community leaders to discuss medical care and access. The ex-Seleka proceeded to rob the office.  Fifteen other individuals, all local chiefs, were killed as well.
One aid worker was killed during clashes at a Palestinian camp in southern Lebanon.

One UN staff member was shot and wounded by two armed men during an attempted carjacking; he has been hospitalized and is in stable condition. A passenger was also present but managed to flee.  The armed men are suspected to be affiliated with Al-Shabaab, but the investigation is still ongoing.
One local NGO staff member was shot and killed by local police forces at a police station in Kismayo.  The individual was injured but later died of his injuries.
One Red Cross worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men when trying to stop them from raping a woman.
A health worker was shot dead by armed men at a clinic.
A vaccinator was killed by an IED.  Further details are unavailable.
A UNHCR driver, on a personal visit to PK12 in BANGUI, was abducted by armed elements believed to belong to an Anti-Balaka faction. His body was later found in PK16.
One INGO national staff member was attacked by a gang and suffered a knife wound to the hand.
The executive director of a local NGO was killed by unidentified armed men.  Some reports state that he was killed or resisting robbery, while others state that it was a targeted killing.
One UN employee was killed when a suicide bomber detonated an IED in a public area of Quetta.
One UN staff member, a security guard supervisor, was found stabbed to death.  The perpetrators and the motive are unknown.
One UN staff member was stabbed during an apparent robbery by unknown assailants.  He was immediately rushed to the hospital, but died upon arrival.
One UN staff member was stabbed and killed by an armed intruder during what seems to be an attempted robbery.
One NGO worker was shot in the leg by militia members, who mistakenly identified him as an Al Qaeda affiliate.
One UN-contracted warehouse worker was shot and killed by armed men suspected to be part of an insurgent group.

One UN-contracted truck driver was severely beaten and killed by unknown armed individuals. The driver's cash and IDs were stolen, but no food from the truck was taken.  The driver's assistant managed to escape and reported the incident to the police.
One UN-contracted truck driver was shot and killed by four armed bandits. The driver's cash and mobile phone were taken.
One UN-contracted assistant driver was shot in the chest and killed by a group of armed men demanding cash.

An NGO ambulance driver was abducted when the vehicle was hijacked by anti-government elements at an illegal checkpoint.

city: Ungot Arabia village (Sar-e Pol-Sozma Qala Road)
details_(public): One national INGO staffer was killed and another wounded when anti-government elements attacked and shot at their vehicle.
Two UN-contracted deminers were injured when a VBIED was remotely detonated against the Afghan National Police.

Four national INGO staff were abducted by armed men.  A fifth employee, the driver, was also abducted but managed to escape.  UPDATE: All four have been released through the mediation of local elders.
An NGO security guard was shot during an armed robbery.  He later died from his wounds two days later, on 18 September.

city: Bishkek, Baitik Baatyr Street, near residential district Zhilgorodok Sovmina
details_(public): A UN consultant suffered a broken nose when attacked by unknown assailants while on his way home.
One national UN worker was severely beaten by FARDC soldiers for having committed adultery.
Eleven NGO personnel were wounded and one killed when a VBIED detonated by an IDP camp.
One UN-contracted worker was injured when a mortar shell hit a warehouse.  He was hospitalized and required surgery to remove shrapnel.
One UN consultant was attacked from behind by an unknown assailant, who unsuccessfully tried to slit her throat.  She was immediately hospitalized and required surgery.
One UN driver was the victim of an armed robbery and was shot in the back twice by unidentified armed men. He was hospitalized and is in stable condition.
Two UN-contracted employees were shot and wounded by police as they were trying to enter the seaport.

Two UN-contracted drivers were severely beaten by local community members for giving a ride to two women who were allegedly running away from their families.  Both drivers were hospitalized and warned not to give rides to non-UN personnel.
One UN-contracted driver was severely injured when a missile hit his truck.  He was hospitalized, and the cargo in the truck was completely destroyed.

city: Zamzam checkpoint, south of El Fasher
details_(public): One UN-contracted driver was shot in the right shoulder by soldiers of the Sudan Armed Forces at a checkpoint.  He was hospitalized immediately.
One national INGO worker was targeted and killed by unknown armed assailants.  It is likely that the killing was linked to the employee's Nuer ethnicity.

Two UN-contracted drivers were abducted by unknown armed groups, who robbed the drivers of their personal belongings and stole the contents of the trucks' cargo. It appears that the owner of the trucks paid a ransom and that the drivers were released.

Three UN-contracted drivers transporting food rations were abducted by unknown armed men.  One was released, but the other two are still being held.  The perpetrators refuse to return the food rations.

Two UN-contracted drivers were stopped by armed groups near Ma'ar Shoreen and forced to drive to an area close to Jabal az Zawiyah, where they were held.  All food rations were taken from the trucks.  The drivers and the trucks were released on 30 June 2013.

One UN-contracted driver was stopped nearby Morek area by an unknown armed group.  He was then taken to Jabal az Zawiyah, where he was held for seven days and his documents and mobile phone confiscated.  He was eventually released with his truck, but without the cargo.
One UN-contracted driver was stopped and detained by an unknown armed group, who requested a ransom.

One UN-contracted driver was stopped by an unknown armed group in Kabajeb village, but was forced to drive to Mhambil village and off-load the cargo.  The driver was detained for two days and was released with his empty truck on 14 September 2013.
Two UN-contracted drivers were detained for 7 days by an unknown armed group, who stole the food rations that the trucks were transporting.  They were eventually released on 14 June 2013.

Two UN-contracted employees (driver and assistant) were abducted by an unknown armed group (suspected to be rebel elements) and the contents of the truck were stolen.  The truck was traveing in a convoy escorted by the Popular Defence Forces.  The driver and the assistant were eventually released on 20 November 2013.

One NGO member was abducted by unknown armed men, believed to be anti-government elements.  One government worker was also abducted.  Both individuals were later released on 18 May 2014 after the intervention of community elders.
One local deminer working for an INGO was kidnapped and killed by anti-government elements.
Two INGO workers were killed when a roadside IED detonated.

Two INGO workers (Italian and British) were abducted by ISIS in northern Syria, close to the Turkish border. UPDATE: The Italian staff member was released over a year later, on 26 May 2014.  The British staff member was tortured and killed on 13 September 2014.
One INGO worker was reportedly killed in an inter-clan dispute.
A local health worker was shot and injured by unidentified gunmen when she was on her way home.
Two local INGO staff members were killed when a roadside IED targeting the INGO vehicle was detonated. One civilian was also killed.

One senior-ranking INGO staff member was abducted by unidentified gunmen as he was returning from a school where he was providing services.  UPDATE: The staff member has been located in Gulran district of Herat province, and Afghan officials are working with district elders to try to secure his release.  Twelve people have been arrested in connection to his kidnapping.  The INGO has suspended services in Afghanistan.
Two NGO workers, while working on a road construction project, were abducted by unknown armed individuals.  Three other staff members were also robbed of their mobile phones.

The head of the ICRC mission in Misrata, while leaving a meeting and walking to his vehicle, was shot and killed when masked gunmen in a car with tinted windows opened fire.  The staff member later died in a nearby hospital.

Nine aid workers (British, Algerian, and Irish) who were delivering aid to Gaza via ship were kidnapped by the ship's owner and captain, who were subsequently detained by Greek police.  One Irish journalist and seven Libyan police officers were also on board and kidnapped.
One INGO national staff member was shot and wounded by an armed man, who proceeded to steal his motorbike.
One INGO deminer was shot and injured. It remains unclear if this was an intentional shooting or a stray bullet.
Eight NGO deminers were killed and three others injured when anti-government elements attacked a minefield.
One driver transporting water for an NGO project was abducted by five anti-government elements.
One INGO worker was injured when Sudan's air force bombed and partially destroyed the INGO hospital.

Two INGO national staff members and one local UN consultant were abducted while traveling to Kutum.  A third INGO staffer, the driver, was also abducted but later released.  The vehicle was later abandoned.  UPDATE: The two INGO staff and the UN consultant were released on 19 July 2014.
One pregnant NGO staff member was assaulted and injured by a male IDP patient.  She was hospitalized for further treatment.
One deminer was found dead with gunshot wounds.  The circumstances leading to his death remain unclear.

Four INGO local personnel and one local contractor were abducted by unknown gunmen.  Fourteen staff members were initially abducted, but nine were released after negotiations.  UPDATE: Two more INGO staff were released on 2 July 2014.

One INGO contractor, accused of being a spy, was abducted by Al Shabaab while transporting supplies from Kenya to Somalia. UPDATE: He was rescued on 10 April 2014 by Kenyan troops who are part of the AU Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) during an operation on the outskirts of the Somali town of Dhobley.
An INGO staff member was on his way to the office when two men on a scooter attempted to steal his laptop bag.  He was stabbed and was treated at a clinic.

One national INGO staff member was abducted by a disgruntled vendor who was contracted by the same INGO.  The incident appears to be related to a contract dispute: the vendor was asked to suspend sales over allegations of misconduct.
One international INGO staff member (Syrian) was attacked and stabbed by two Turkish assailants, one of whom was the staff member's neighbor.  Attack seems targeted, but motive unknown.

An INGO-contracted driver, while driving from a program site to a hotel parking lot, was shot and killed by most likely ex-Seleka soldiers.  There may have been an ethnic/religious component to the attack.
One INGO security guard was killed while one his way from home to the INGO compound. There are no clear details about how he was killed.

One national INGO social worker was injured during an altercation with a group of Syrian refugees.  There was a disagreement concerning service delivery between the social worker and one of the Syrian refugees, and more than 25 other Syrian refugees became involved. The social worker and one of the refugees were hospitalized.

One female INGO staff member, while exercising at a cricket club, was attacked by an unknown man, who broke her arm and attempted to drag her to an overgrown area.  The staff member was able to scream, at which point the assailant left as others came to help her.
Six deminers were killed and one wounded when anti-government elements attacked the demining operation site.  One person is also missing.
One UN-contracted driver was stopped and detained for five days by Al Nosrah Front.
Two UN-contracted drivers were stopped and detained by Al Nosrah Front.
One UN-contracted driver was abducted by unknown individuals, who demanded money for his release.  Both the driver and the truck were released 35 days later.

Three UN-contracted individuals (driver and 2 assistants) were kidnapped by unknown armed men aboard two Land Cruiser vehicles. The driver, the two assistants, and the truck were released six days later.
Two UN-contracted individuals (driver and assistant) were abducted by an unknown armed group.  The driver, his assistant, and the truck were released 20 days later.
One UN-contracted driver was kidnapped by an armed group called Shareea Court.  Attempts to contact the driver have been unsuccessful thus far.

city: area between Tor Taan and Shorum
details_(public): One UN-contracted driver was abducted by a rebel group on board a Land Cruiser.

One UN agency contractor was killed in an attack by Al-Shabaab on a government forces vehicle. The victim was reportedly connected with the government and was not targeted for his capacity as an aid agency contractor.

Four INGO national staff members returning from a project visit were abducted by anti-government elements at an illegal checkpoint.  UPDATE: two of the four INGO national staff members were released on 20 July and 21 July 2014; the other two remain unaccounted for.
One UN worker was killed due to an air strike.  The attack also killed her husband and daughter (not counted in database).
One UN worker was killed while fleeing from fighting in Shejaiya district.  Ten members of her family (not counted in database) were also killed in the attack.
One UN worker was killed during an air strike as he was on his way home.
One UN international staff member was abducted by gunmen on a Land Cruiser.  UPDATE: he was released on 25 July 2014.
Two international aid workers, while in a taxi on the way to their office, were killed by gunmen on a motorcycle.
Two INGO staff members were killed by anti-government elements.  Civilians and Afghan government and military personnel were also killed in the attack.
One national INGO staff member was seriously injured when a car bomb exploded close to a busy market.  The staff member died soon after arriving at the hospital.
One Palestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was killed and three others wounded when their ambulance (clearly marked with the emblem of the Red Crescent society) was targeted in Beit Hanoun.
One Palestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was shot and killed.

Two UN-contracted drivers were kidnapped by unknown armed men.  The trucks' contents and the drivers' personal belongings were also taken.  They were kept by their kidnappers until a ransom was paid by the owner of the trucks.
One UN guard was killed during an air strike in Rafah in southern Gaza.
One INGO worker was pulled out of the INGO vehicle and shot and killed, allegedly by the Mabanese Defense Forces.  It appears that the killing was related to the individual's ethnicity.
One INGO staff member was shot and critically injured during an attempted carjacking/robbery. Three others were also in the vehicle, but they were unharmed.
Two INGO staff members were critically injured when they were physically assaulted with machetes during an attempted robbery.
Five ICRC staff members were abducted by a local armed group while traveling to deliver aid in Herat province.  UPDATE: All 5 were released unharmed on 20 August.
Three local employees of a demining NGO were abducted by anti-government elements. The vehicles have been recovered, but no information concerning the abductees.
Two female international aid workers were kidnapped by armed men. No further information is available.
A national contractor of an INGO was killed by individuals who are suspected to be part of the LRA.  His three children (not counted here) were also abducted.
One local Red Cross worker was killed by a bullet while trying to evacuate casualties during violent demonstrations in front of the MINUSCA headquarters in Bangui.
Three INGO national staff members were abducted by unknown men.  They were released unhurt two days later, on 26 August.
Three INGO staff members, while driving a truck to Ndele, were stopped and detained by Anti-Balaka.  There are unconfirmed reports that two of the three may have been killed the next day.
An NGO staff member was physically assaulted by the Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC) for suspected collaboration with the Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (APCLS).

Three local INGO staff members were dragged out of their vehicle and shot and killed by the Mabanese Defense Forces.  It appears that the killing was ethnically motivated. A third passenger was also shot and killed (not counted here).

One INGO staff member was killed by the Mabanese Defense Forces at his home and another staffer, also hiding in the house, was abducted. It appears that the killing was ethnically motivated. A third staffer, also hiding in the house, managed to get away.
One NGO ambulance driver was abducted.  He was released on 31 August following negotiation by community elders and a ransom payment.

Two national INGO doctors were abducted by individuals suspected to be part of the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).  They were released the following day after family members reportedly paid a ransom.
Two guards on duty at an INGO health center were abducted by two armed men who broke in and also stole some property.  The two guards were released the next day.
One ICRC-contracted driver was shot and wounded when the convoy he was traveling with was robbed by armed men.

One national UN staff member was injured by armed robbers when returning home with his wife.  The UN staff member is in stable condition at the hospital.  It is suspected that the robbers were members of the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (FARDC).
Three female teachers and one driver working for a local NGO were killed when their vehicle struck an IED.  Two children were also killed in the blast.
A local NGO senior staff member was shot and killed while resisting a kidnap attempt.
One INGO staff member was abducted outside his home and killed.  It appears to have been a personal matter, and not related to his employment with the INGO.
One UN staff member was abducted on the Damascus-Aleppo Road.
Three local NGO staff members were kidnapped by unknown gunmen while traveling in a local taxi in Kulachi area.
One UN staff member was assaulted by SPLA soldiers and required medical treatment.  Another UN staff member was also assaulted, but seems to have been unhurt.

One INGO staff member, along with seven other individuals (government officials and journalists), was killed in a mob attack.  The group was part of an Ebola education team.  It appears that the community members attacked because they believed that health workers were spreading the disease.
One INGO national staff member was abducted by anti-government elements at the INGO demining site.
Seven INGO staff members were wounded by the explosion of a grenade, which detonated while they were cleaning a ditch.
Six NGO contractors were abducted by anti-government elements.  They were released the following day through the mediation of tribal elders.
One ICRC worker was killed when a shell landed near the office.
One INGO worker was kidnapped by ISIS in Ar-Raqqah, while on his way to Deir Ezzour.  UPDATE: The individual was killed in November 2014.

city: Ifo 2 Refugee Camp area, Dadaab, Garissa District
details_(public): A paramedic for the Kenyan Red Cross Society was injured when three gunmen shot at the ambulance after the driver ignored instructions to stop.
One INGO nurse was killed by a stray mortar during clashes between clan militias.  The nurse was assisting the wounded at the time of the attack.
One UN polio worker was killed in an IED explosion. Two others (not counted) were also killed in the attack.
One INGO national staff member working at Marka General Hospital was shot and killed by unknown armed militia.  The incident was reportedly related to clan revenge.
One national UN staff member was kidnapped at gunpoint from Malakal airport by eight armed men.
A driver, who was driving as part of an INGO humanitarian convoy, was wounded when an armed militia attacked.
One INGO security guard was injured when a shooting broke out in front of a medical health facility managed by the INGO.
One LNGO manager was wounded during clashes between two groups of Al Shabaab fighters. The clash was reportedly triggered by a dispute over the continuation of the LNGO's activities.
One INGO employee was killed during clashes between two groups of Somali National Government (SNG) forces.

city: Mogadishu, Jaale Siyad Military Academy area
details_(public): Two LNGO staff were injured when Somali National Government (SNG) forces opened fire on the LNGO vehicle, allegedly because the vehicle did not stop when ordered to do so. The two staff were taken to a hospital.
An INGO security guard was shot and injured by an unknown armed man.  The attack may have been connected to an inter-clan dispute.
An INGO security guard was shot and wounded by a member of the Somali National Government forces.  The attack appears to be related to a dispute over INGO employment.
An INGO-contracted driver was shot and kiled by an unidentified gunman.
One INGO international staff member was injured when two individuals on a boda boda stole her purse.  The staff member was hospitalized but released soon thereafter.
One INGO staff member was injured when shooting broke out during what seems to have been an inter-clan attack.
An INGO guard was wounded during an Al Shabaab attack.
Five local NGO staff members were abducted by unidentified gunmen.
One INGO driver was carjacked and beaten by three armed men.  He suffered injuries to his face and arm.  The attack occured in the evening.

Two INGO staff were killed, one injured, and three abducted by armed men; the abducted individuals have since been released.  The INGO convoy was on its way to its operations site when the attack occurred.  Four local police who were escorting the convoy were also killed.
One ICRC staff member, while visting Maimana prison to distribute winter clothes, was stabbed in the throat by a prisoner.  He was hospitalized immediately.
One INGO security guard was shot and wounded by unknown persons while on duty at Batil camp.  He sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized.

Two UN-contracted drivers and seven loaders were kidnapped while transporting food and relief items; the two trucks were also taken. UPDATE: The seven loaders were released the next day, the two drivers were released on 18 November 2014, and the trucks have been recoverd.
An international aid worker was kidnapped and later beheaded by terrorists.
Three NGO staff were abducted by opposition forces from their private vehicle as they drove toward Jalalabad. Tribal elders negotiated their release three days later.
One INGO employee was killed an another injured in a carjacking attempt.

A Taliban raid on an INGO guest house killed one Afghan staffer and the South African director (along with his two children). The raid came amidst a spate of attacks on internationals in Kabul, and unsubstantiated rumors of Christian missionary activities regarding this INGO.
Four Somali staff of a security firm contracted by the UN were killed when an Al Shabaab suicide bomber attacked a UN convoy near the Mogadishu airport.
An INGO vehicle was ambushed by armed men while it carreid a patient to a hospital. The driver (and the patient) received serious stab wounds.
A German national working for a local NGO was among those killed on a sucide bombing attach of a French school in Kabul.
One national Red Cross volunteer was killed by crossfire in armed clashes in Mbres.
column: Bagoro 2, Mbrès, Nana-Grébizi, Central African Republic

details_(public): National staff of INGO kidnapped and released four days later.
Militants shot and killed a volunteer YRCS Taiz branch officer and his volunteer driver.
While using his private vehicle, an INGO national staff member was abducted while dropping off a colleague at home. He was released on 5th February.
One staff person was injured when bombs dropped by the Sudanese Air Force landed on a hospital operated by an INGO. The hospital is located in the Nuba Mountains village of Frandala.

A local driver for an INGO was assaulted by two SPLA soldiers when stopped at a roundabout while driving in Agok. The soliders, who had stopped behind him in their own vehicle, forced him out of his car. UNISFA soliders intervened to stop the attack.
A team of five aid workers was attacked in Guinea by a crowd that grew hostile when the team started collecting bodies believed to be infected with Ebola. One the aid workers sustained a neck wound.
Two Syrian Arab Red Crescent (SARC) volunteers were killed when a mortar shell hit a civilian area of Homs as they transported supplies.
A french aidworker working for a charity organization was abducted at gunpoint in Bangui, Central African Republic and released unharmed on January 23, 2015.
A UN staff member was assaulted by an INGO security guard. The UN staff member was taken to the hospital as a result of the attack.
1 Syrian Arab Red Crescent volunteer was killed in the line of duty.
One Syrian Arab Red Crescent (SARC) volunteer was killed in the line of duty. No further details are currently available.
One Syrian Red Crescent (SARC) volunteer was killed in the line of duty. No further information is available at this time.
One Syrian Red Crescent (SARC) volunteer was killed in the line of duty. No further information is available at this time.
One Syrian Arab Red Crescent volunteer was killed on duty. There is no further information available at this time.
One Syrian Red Crescent volunteer was injured when unknown assailants fired upon the vehicle he was traveling in when delivering aid.
An NGO staff member was shot and killed for unknown reasons in Khogyani District.
UN personnel was severely injured by a mortar shell when walking home from work.
A national UN staff member was assaulted by security forces while on his way to visit family members.
Two local INGO employees and their driver were injured when a IED detonated against their unmarked vehicle in Samangan Province.

Three aid workers from the Sudanese Red Crescent were killed and one seriously injured while returning from the town of Kurmuk after supporting a humanitarian relief mission in the field. The circumstances surrounding their deaths are currently unknown however, some media reports allude to armed movements in the area.
A UN contractor was killed outside her home when she confronted her attacker, a man who was trying to steal her bicycle.
Three health sector workers of a NGO were kidnapped in Shalai, Uruzgan district while treating patients in the field. An additional staff member was severely beaten and then set free.

Five local volunteers of a INGO were attacked by IDPs inside of a PoC area. The staff members were rescued by UNPOL and FPU, and an investigation is being conducted to establish the cause of the attack.

NGO vehicle and driver were hijacked by armed persons in Rodat District while on the Jalalabad-Torkham highway. The driver was kidnapped and the vehicle was taken. An NGO staff member that was in the vehicle was injured in the attack but managed to escape.
An INGO worker was driving in his private vehicle when armed individuals, who were attempting to stop the car, opened fire. The INGO worker was taken to hospital.
Five armed men attacked a team of 8 UN contractors that were working on a demining project and hijacked their vehicle. The driver was kidnapped and found unharmed on 8th January.

A Myanmar Red Cross volunteer was injured in an attack on a Red Cross convoy traveling from Laukkai. Clashes between ethnic Kokang rebels and the Myanmar army have flared up in recent weeks, although the Myanmar Nationalities Democratic Alliance Army (the main Kokang rebel group) denied any part in the attack.

An Guinea Red Cross volunteer was wounded in an attack by a mob in Forecariah when she tried to provide a buriel for a woman suspected to have died from Ebola. Another volunteer was attacked during the incident as but sustained no serious injuries.

An American aid worker was killed in Raqqa, Syria. She was initially kidnapped by militants on August 3rd, 2013. ISIS militants alledge that she was killed in retaliatory Jordanian airstrikes on Raqqa. The circumstances surrounding her death are contested by administration officials in the Jordanian and American governments, who believe that the aid worker was killed by ISIS.
A British aid worker was shot in his car by someone in a secondary vehicle that had pulled up behind him while he was returning to the organizational compound.
A female international aid worker was released after two weeks in captivity by the Taliban that kidnapped her during a raid on the aid organization's compound.

Two volunteers from the Myanmar Red Cross Society were injured when the convoy that they were traveling in was attacked. The volunteers were part of humanitarian Red Cross marked convoy that was evacuating civilians displaced by fighting in the northern Shan state. The volunteers were taken to hospital with head and abdominal wounds and one of them required surgery for their wounds.Update: Despite recieivng medical attention, one of the volunteers passed away on 27 March, 2015, as a result of the gunshot wound sustained in the the attack.

A UN staff member was killed in a suicide blast on a mosque in Peshawar. Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan have claimed responsibility for the attack, which killed at least 19 people attending afternoon prayer service.
One UN hired consultant and her translator were kidnapped from their car in Sana'a by armed men who were posing as police officers.
An off duty volunteer was killed when a morter shell hit Nirim kibbutz.

One INGO international aid worker and one national staff person were injured when their car was carjacked by a group of armed men. The aid worker was returning to his compound when the attack occurred at the gate of the compound. As the armed men were fleeing in the vehicle they stole, they indiscrimantly shot rounds at the compound, hitting the INGO worker in the leg and the driver in the neck, both who have received medical attention for their wounds and will recover.
Two INGO national staff members were seriously injured during an air assault (an additional member suffered minor injuries).
A volunteer for the Syrian branch of the Palestine Red Crescent, was shot and killed in a refugee camp near Damascus.
A Red Crescent volunteer was shot and killed while evacuating wounded people.

A Malian Red Cross volunteer was ambushed by MUJAO while driving an aid truck from Goa to Niamey. Armed militants opened fire on the vehicle and shot the volunteer, who died. Another volunteer--the passenger--was wounded in the attack. The extent of the passenger's injuries is currently unknown.MUJAO allegedly stated that the INGO was attacked because it is working for the enemy۝.

Two Syrian Arab Red Crescent (SARC) volunteers, one from the Idlib branch and one from the Maaret al-Nouman sub-branch, were killed while retrieving bodies of the deceased from near the SARC Idlib branch and preparing shelters for people fleeing from the fighting in the city.
Two brothers working for a local branch of the Yemen Red Crescent Society were shot dead in the southern port city of Aden while evacuating wounded people to an ambulance.
An INGO aid worker was killed when a shell fell on his home in Aleppo, Syria.

Five aid workers were shot and killed, weeks after being abducted in Trinkot, Uruzgan province. The kidnapping occurred on March 3rd by armed gunmen alledgedly belonging to the Taliban, even though no group has yet claimed the attack. The bodies of the five aid workers were discovered in Chanarto district on April 10th.

Four international UN staff members were killed when a roadside bomb exploded next to their minibus. They were traveling from their guesthouse to their office in Garowe. The Shabab, a extremist group with links to Al-Qaeda, claimed responsibilty for the attack, according to The Associated Press.

One international INGO worker was kidnapped when stopped at an illegal checkpoint manned by anti-government forces that were posing as Afghan Notional Police officers. Update: the German aid worker, who was abducted by the Taliban, was freed during a police operation on May 29th.
A INGO convoy carrying food was ambushed in Poktap area of Duk county, Jonglei. One person was killed in the attack and the other was injured.
A INGO guard sustained minor wounds to the neck when he was shot by an unidentified source. He was transported to a medical facility for treatment.

A international staff member was driving to the office on a motorcyle with his laptop when he was attacked by two young men. A struggle for the laptop ensued, which the staff member was able to hold onto, but he lost control of the motorcycle. He sustained a knee fracture that required evacuation to Uganda for medical attention.
Three male staff members contracted by a INGO were kidnapped by ISIS and released approximatelythree months later.
A local national security guard was assaulted and shot in the leg when armed robbers broke into the premises of the INGO office. The guard was knocked unconscious and the robbers stole the cash box.
Two national staff members of an INGO were taken from their office by ISIS for questioning. There is no further information on whether they have been released.
A national staff member was kidnapped and detained in Tell Abyad by ISIS and then transfered to Ar-Raqqa. He is still being detained as of 03/2015.
A national staff member was stabbed several times and declared dead on arrive at the hospital. The suspect was apprehended.

A staff member was shot and killed during a armed robbery. The staffer and a the driver were on their way from Mbarara town in South Western Uganda to Kampala. They were intercepted by the robbers in Kyabagaza Village in Butambala District where a verbal altercation occurred between the individuals and resulted in the staff member being shot. The vehicle and the driver were taken to a romote location and stripped of his belongings.
Two INGO international staff members were wounded during an armed robbery at the office.

city: Camp, Kule refugee camp, 31 miles from Pagak
details_(public): An INGO driver was assaulted by 5 youths after getting out of his truck to apologise for splashing someone when driving past.

city: Camp, Kule refugee camp, 31 miles from Pagak
details_(public): An INGO driver and two passengers in a water supply truck were attacked en-route within their project site when they stopped. A group of people on the road attacked them after an altercation, which resulted in the physical assault of the passenger. The driver and secondary passenger managed to run away with minor injuries (not counted here).
Knife attack by three men on INGO and INGO partner staff member in bar. The 2 men were taken to hospital for emergency care.
A INGO consultant was shot in the leg when armed individuals attacked the bar he was in with grenades and small arms.
A national staff member's home was raided by 4 men, who shot him in the leg and kidnapped his daughter (not counted in AWSD). She was later released after being sexually assaulted.

A national staff member was shot and killed by security forces who were engaging the crowd with small arms fire at a demonstration. His role in the demonstration is unknown since he lived in the vicinity.
One female international UN consultant was sexually assaulted at knifepoint at home while sleeping.

A national staff member in Burtinle, Somalia was assaulted and stabbed with a knife at home by two individuals that had personal grievances against the aid agency that employed the female staff member.
IED attack. The attack wounded one male national staff worker. No further information is available.
A national staff member in Nairobi was assaulted at home when burglers broke into his private residence to rob the house during the night. He was hospitalized as a result of his injuries.
One international aid worker was hospitalized after being attacked with machetes during a robbery.
Three assailants armed with stones attacked an international staff member and robbed him. The staff member was hospitalzed as a result of his injuries.
An international staff member of an INGO was injured in an VBIED explosion.

Seven national staff members were kidnapped in Badakhshan. They were released 3 days later, after negotiations between the organizations' network and a local representative took place. The kidnappers demanded a ransom, which went unpaid.

A national staff member of an INGO was assasinated on his way home from work by a gunman who shot him five times and drove away with his accomplice on a motorcycle. The incident was most likely the result of a personal grievance.

Police killed four Taliban suicide bombers during an attack on the Green Village, acompound housing foreign workers in Kabul. While the AGE did not reach their intended target (inside the compound), the force of the blast at the heavy guarded gate of the compound wounded one INGO staff worker.
One local INGO staff member was shot by crossfire during a private dispute while standing outside the clinic. Hospitalized, he is in stable condition.
A driver for a de-mining NGO was abducted while driving inMazar-e Sharif, Balkh province. He was released on the 7th of May 2015.
Three INGO staff members were killed when ambushed by AGE while inspecting a project site.

An INGO contracted national staff member was kidnapped by ISIS when he went to retrieve office belongings, which were confiscated on the previous day when ISIS had raided the organization's office. He was released after about a month.
A VBIED went off in Salamiyah town, severally damaging four trucks with food provisions. One sub-contracted driver for the UN was killed in the exposion and one was wounded as a result of the attack.
A convoy of trucks with provisions were hit by a large explosion on their way to Deir Ezzor city. Two truck drivers subcontracted by the UN were killed by the exposion and 3 were injured.

A UN national staff member was attacked with acid at his house in Khajura Nepalgunj which left him with burns on his head, face, chest and other severe injuries at required extensive hospitalization. While the suspect has not been apprehended, it is possible that this could have been a personal attack as a result of a family dispute.

A UN national staff member was shot multiple times by three people in the leg and hand. The incident occured not far from the staffer's home while he was on his way to work. According to a police investigation, this incident was the result of a private dispute.

One national aid worker was kidnapped by unknown assailants in Jaramana, Syria. He was released in Beirut 15 days later on February 23, 2014 after negotiations took place between the kidnappers and his family.

One UN partner was kidnapped by anti-government elements while monitoring a program in Isfandeh village, Ghazni city. He was released on 9th July 2014 after tribal leaders were involved in the negotiations for his release.

A UN contracted truck driver and his assistant were kidnapped off the road between Nyala and Gereida while driving a truck filled with provisions. The truck was also taken. At the time of this writing, the two national contracted staff members are still missing.

A team of Red Cross volunteers was attacked by a group of people that pelted the team with bricks and stones. One Red Cross volunteer that managed to return to their vehicle was wounded by shards of glass in her eye when the car window was hit by the a stone and shattered. She was taken to the hospital and had the glass removed from her eye.
One national staff member was wounded when a bomb went off in front of the office.

city: Ed Daein (origin point), road between Shorum and Tor-Taan
details_(public): A UN contracted truck driver and his truck was hijacked off of a convoy by an unknown armed group while en-route from Ed Daien to Nyala. The whereabouts of the driver are unknown.

Two UN-contracted truck drivers were kidnapped while off-loading provisions from their truck by anti-government elements (AGE). AGE elements assaulted the truck drivers and forced them to reload the truck before taking the trucks and drivers to an unknown location. The drivers were released with the trucks (but not the commodities) after three days of negotiations with community leaders.
A national female staff worker for an INGO was attacked in her home with a machete during a home invasion. She fully recovered in the hospital.
A national male staff member for an INGO was ambushed by the Taliban while driving aid supplies. He was released on the 27th December 2014.
A male staff member of a INGO was abducted and murdered by Taliban members who attacked him with machetes and axes.
A male staff member was found shot and killed in Sharan district of Paktika province, along with two civilians (not counted in AWSD). The perpetrators of the attack are unknown.
One national INGO aid worker was assaulted in Bangui while on his way home after work. He later died in the hospital as a result of his injuries.

A national staff member (security guard) of an INGO was abducted by unknown armed men. He was beaten and released on 30 December 2014. The reason for the abduction and assault was in revenge for a work related decision that affected another contracted employee.

Unidentified gunmen shot at a car in which the chief of the Turkish Red Crescent in Istanbul, was traveling. Although the chief was able to escape, his driver was shot in the stomach. The driver was treated atmraniye State Hospital.

city: Pariang road, close to Maymom Junction
details_(public): A UN contracted truck traveling as part of a convoy was ambushed on Pariang road. The truck was burnt and the driver of the truck is missing.

A UN contracted truck was commandered by the SPLA in Khor Adar with demands to transport troops to Akoka. The location of the truck and three staff members is unknown, but they were on-route to a relief distribution site in Melut with supplies when intercommunal fighting occurred along the road.
One INGO national staff member was shot in the Kassengor area along the border of Eastern Equatoria and Jonglei.

According to a local media report, 4 aid workers for an INGO, along with 3 private company staff members (not counted here), were kidnapped in Gedo by armed gunmen thought to be part of Al Shabaab. The aid workers were allegedly abducted between Garilley and Fafahdun towns and taken to Bardere.
A Syrian Red Cross volunteer died in the line duty. Note: This incident was verified by the IFRC. Further details were not available.
A Syrian Red Cross volunteer died in the line of duty. Note: This incident was verified by the IFRC. Further details were not available.
A SARC volunteer died as a result of injuries he reportedly sustained in detention. This incident was verified by the IFRC. Further details surrounding the incident are not available.

A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated in front of Aroma Restaurant at Makah Al-Mukaram Road (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening. The restaurant was hosting an event to mark 60th anniversary of the founding of the Somali flag. Thirteen people were killed while 18 others were injured, one of the casualties was a local staff member of a INGO.

A gunman hailing from Dir clan shot and killed a local NGO staff from Majerteen/Biciid yahan sub-clan in Galkacyo in the morning of 25/10. The killing is reportedly linked with verification of IDP registrations.

Al-Shabaabfighters abducted two local NGO staff members in Toosweyne. The abducted staff members were on a mission to visit a health facility in the area and were working on an immunization program. The NGO staff workers were released on 11/12 after 17 days in detention after the intervention of local elders.

SNG soldier shot and killed a UN contracted driver of a truck carrying food aid in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar). The incident happened following an unknown dispute. The perpetrator was arrested.
Clashes between anti-government armed groups resulted in the death of one INGO staff member and a number of civilians (not counted).
An NGO vehicle was stopped at an illegal checkpoint in the Ibrahim Abad area of Pashtun Kot district. One NGO staff member was abducted, one security escort was killed.
Two INGO staff members and their driver were abducted by gunmen in Pashtun Kot district along the Maimana-Bilichiragh highway.
Three UN contracted demining personnel were abducted on Goma-Rutshuru road in North Kivu province by armed gunmen.
A UN staff member was assaulted by soldiers while walking to work along Airport Road in Juba. They accused him of spying. The staff member suffered injuries to his face and bruised ribs.
